{"step_by_step_thinking": "Non-immune hydrops fetalis is a serious fetal condition defined by abnormal accumulation of fluid in two or more fetal compartments, including ascites, pleural effusion, pericardial effusion, and skin edema. It can also be associated with a thickened placenta, and fetal hydrops. However, cardiomegaly is not a typical feature of non-immune hydrops fetalis. It is more commonly associated with conditions that cause high-output cardiac failure.", "answer_choice": "D. Cardiomegaly"}
